resources.string: Your open tabs will be shown here.
Your private tabs will be shown here.

%1$s clears your search and browsing history from private tabs when you close them or quit the app. While this doesn’t make you anonymous to websites or your internet service provider, it makes it easier to keep what you do online private from anyone else who uses this device.
Leave no traces on this device
%1$s deletes your cookies, history, and site data when you close all your private tabs. %2$s
Who might be able to see my activity?
Launch your next private tab in one tap.
You can set %1$s to automatically open links in apps.
Tap here to start a fresh private session. Delete your history, cookies — everything.
On a website, this bar tucks away as you scroll down for extra browsing space.
Tap and hold the arrows to jump between pages in this tab’s history.
Swipe the toolbar to switch tabs
Swipe left or right to switch. Swipe left on your last tab to open a new tab.
Camera access needed. Go to Android settings, tap permissions, and tap allow.
Set open tabs to close automatically that haven’t been viewed in the past day, week, or month.
Tabs you haven’t viewed for two weeks get moved here.
%1$s can close tabs you haven’t viewed over the past month.
You have extensions installed, but not enabled
Extensions level up your browsing, from changing how %s looks and performs to boosting privacy and safety.
To use extensions, enable them in settings or by selecting “%s” below.
Xiaomi devices may need extra permissions to add shortcuts to the home screen. Please check your settings.
Reader View, Translate, Report broken site, Print, Share, Open app
Reader View, Translate, Print, Share, Open app
Reader View, Report broken site, Print, Share, Open app
Reader View, Print, Share, Open app
Add bookmark, Shortcut, Home, Collection, PDF
Find what you need faster, from private browsing to save actions.
Allow search suggestions in private sessions?
%s will share everything you type in the address bar with your default search engine.
Search directly from the address bar
Welcome to a more personal internet
More colours. Better privacy. Same commitment to people over profits.
Switching screens is easier than ever
Pick up where you left off with tabs from other devices now on your homepage.
Your tabs are syncing! Pick up where you left off on your other device.
Find out why millions love Firefox
Our non-profit backed browser helps stop companies from secretly following you around the web.
More than 100 million people protect their privacy by choosing a browser that’s backed by a nonprofit.
Known trackers? Blocked automatically. Extensions? Try all 700. PDFs? Our built-in reader makes them easy to manage.
Stay encrypted when you hop between devices
Firefox encrypts your passwords, bookmarks, and more when you’re synced.
Notifications help you stay safer with Firefox
Securely send tabs between your devices and discover other privacy features in Firefox.
With Firefox on your home screen, you’ll have easy access to the privacy-first browser that blocks cross-site trackers.
Add third-party extensions to enhance your security, productivity, and more.
Anti-tracking gem. Stop invisible trackers and spying ads.
See an interesting pic and learn more about it.
Custom dark mode for the mobile web.
Crash reports allow us to diagnose and fix issues with the browser. Reports may include personal or sensitive data.
Send technical and interaction data to Mozilla
Data about your device, hardware configuration, and how you use Firefox helps improve features, performance, and stability for everyone.
By continuing, you agree to the %1$s.
Firefox cares about your privacy. Learn more in our %1$s.
To help improve the browser, Firefox sends diagnostic and interaction data to Mozilla. %1$s
When you share how you discovered Firefox and that you use it, you help us introduce our browser to more people.
Share minimal data with Mozilla’s marketing technology partners. This data is never sold or used to show you ads.
Share how you discovered Firefox, and that you use it, with Mozilla’s marketing partners. This data is never sold.
Large header image of the toolbar selection view showing an illustrated toolbar.
See the web in the best light.
Large header image of the theme selection view showing illustrated artist and builder tools.
Edit engines visible in the search menu
Engines visible on the search menu
Open links in a private tab
If allowed, private tabs will also be visible when multiple apps are open
Cookie Banner Blocker in private browsing
Turn on Cookie Banner Blocker for %1$s?
Turn off Cookie Banner Blocker for %1$s?
%1$s can’t automatically reject cookie requests on this site. You can send a request to support this site in the future.
Turn off and %1$s will clear cookies and reload this site. This may sign you out or empty shopping carts.
Turn on and %1$s will try to automatically refuse all cookie banners on this site.
Less distractions, less cookies tracking you on this site.
Automatically attempts to connect to sites using HTTPS encryption protocol for increased security.
Most likely, the website simply does not support HTTPS.

However, it’s also possible that an attacker is involved. If you continue to the website, you should not enter any sensitive info. If you continue, HTTPS-Only mode will be turned off temporarily for the site.
Sign in to sync tabs, bookmarks, passwords, and more.
Get suggestions from the web related to your search
Include %1$s download link on WhatsApp shares
Invite your friends to try faster, safer browsing with %1$s every time you share a link on WhatsApp.
Quitting the application to apply changes…
If you trust this extension, you can give it permission on every website.
This extension doesn’t require any permissions.
Extension collection modified. Quitting the application to apply changes…
Choose a wallpaper that speaks to you.
Check out 100+ new extensions that let you make Firefox your own.

One or more extensions stopped working, making your system unstable. %1$s unsuccessfully tried to restart the extension(s).

Extensions won’t be restarted during your current session.

Removing or disabling extensions may fix this issue.
Change your password, manage data collection, or delete your account
Notifications for tabs received from other Firefox devices.
Exceptions let you disable tracking protection for selected sites.
Data about your device, hardware configuration, and usage helps us improve Firefox features, performance, and stability.
Share how you discovered Firefox and that you use it with Mozilla’s marketing technology partners.
This helps Mozilla to estimate active users.
Learn more about daily usage ping
This helps us diagnose and fix issues with the browser. Reports may include personal or sensitive data.
Allows Mozilla to install and run studies
Scan the QR code shown at firefox.com/pair
Swipe toolbar up to open tabs
Scroll to hide address bar and toolbar
Swipe address bar sideways to switch tabs
Opening this many tabs may slow down %s while the pages are loading. Are you sure you want to continue?
Homepage after four hours of inactivity
Open on homepage after four hours
Tabs you haven’t viewed for two weeks get moved to the inactive section.
Try out features and ideas before they’re released to everyone.
Private Tabs Open: %1$s. Tap to switch tabs.
Synced Tabs Open: %1$s. Tap to switch tabs.
Help make %1$s better for everyone. Mozilla employees use the info you send to fix website problems.
Are you sure you want to delete this folder?
Are you sure you want to delete the selected items?
Sign in to see synced bookmarks
Save sites as you browse. Sign in to grab bookmarks from other synced devices.
Save sites as you browse. We’ll also grab bookmarks from other synced devices.
Add bookmarks as you browse so you can find your favourite sites later.
Block audio and video on cellular data only
Audio and video will play on Wi-Fi
Collect the things that matter to you.\nGroup together similar searches, sites, and tabs for quick access later.
To send a tab, sign in to Firefox on at least one other device.
Tap or swipe this notification to close private tabs.
Browse with no saved cookies or history in %1$s
Private browsing in %1$s doesn’t save your info.
Find something nearby. Or discover something fun.
Please help make Firefox better by taking a short survey.
Are you sure you want to delete %1$s?
This is sample text. It is here to show how text will appear when you increase or decrease the size with this setting.
Make text on websites larger or smaller
Font size will match your Android settings. Disable to manage font size here.
You’ll be logged out of most sites
Automatically deletes browsing data when you select \"Quit\" from the main menu
Removes history (including history synced from other devices)
%s will delete the selected browsing data.
On your computer open Firefox and go to https://firefox.com/pair
No account? <u>Create one</u> to sync Firefox between devices.
%s will stop syncing with your account, but won’t delete any of your browsing data on this device.
Now featuring Total Cookie Protection, our most powerful barrier yet against cross-site trackers.
%s protects you from many of the most common trackers that follow what you do online.
Pages will load normally, but block fewer trackers.
What’s blocked by standard tracking protection
Stronger tracking protection and faster performance, but some sites may not work properly.
What’s blocked by strict tracking protection
Choose which trackers and scripts to block.
What’s blocked by custom tracking protection
All third-party cookies (may cause websites to break)
All cookies (will cause websites to break)
Tell websites not to share & sell data
Limits the ability of social networks to track your browsing activity around the web.
Blocks cookies that ad networks and analytics companies use to compile your browsing data across many sites.
Total Cookie Protection isolates cookies to the site you’re on so trackers like ad networks can’t use them to follow you across sites.
Prevents malicious scripts gaining access to your device to mine digital currency.
Stops uniquely identifiable data from being collected about your device that can be used for tracking purposes.
Stops outside ads, videos, and other content from loading that contains tracking code. May affect some website functionality.
Protections are ON for this site
Protections are OFF for this site
Enhanced Tracking Protection is off for these websites
Clears cookies set by redirects to known tracking websites.
Enables fingerprinting protection to stop suspected fingerprinters.
Some trackers marked below have been partially unblocked on this page because you interacted with them *.
Enhanced tracking protection exception preference icon

Domain Name System (DNS) over HTTPS sends your request for a domain name through an encrypted connection, providing a secure DNS and making it harder for others to see which website you’re about to access. %1$s
%1$s decides when to use secure DNS to protect your privacy.
Use your default DNS resolver if there is a problem with the secure DNS provider
Use a local provider, if possible. %1$s
Turn off when VPN, parental control, or enterprise policies are active
Turn off when a network tells %1$s it shouldn’t use secure DNS. %2$s
You control when to use secure DNS and choose your provider.
Only use your default DNS resolver if there is a problem with secure DNS
%1$s will always use secure DNS. You’ll see a security risk warning before we use your system DNS.
Only use the provider you select
Always warn if secure DNS isn’t available
If secure DNS is not available sites will not load or function properly
%1$s won’t use secure DNS on these sites and their subdomains.
Debug menu: %1$d click(s) left to enable
You can easily add this website to your device’s Home screen to have instant access and browse faster with an app-like experience.
Fill and save usernames and passwords in websites while using %1$s.
Fill usernames and passwords in other apps on your device.
The passwords you save or sync to %s will be listed here. All passwords you save are encrypted.
%s won’t save passwords for sites listed here.
%s won’t save passwords for these sites.
Unlock to view your saved passwords
Set up a device lock pattern, PIN, or password to protect your saved passwords from being accessed if someone else has your device.
Enable to allow pinch and zoom, even on websites that prevent this gesture.
%s encrypts all payment methods you save
Includes phone numbers and email addresses
Unlock to view your saved cards
Set up a device lock pattern, PIN, or password to protect your saved payment methods from being accessed if someone else has your device.
Unlock to use saved payment methods
Check that search string matches Example format
This page is stored on your device.
Are you sure that you want to clear all the cookies and data for the site %s?
Are you sure that you want to clear all the permissions on all sites?
Are you sure that you want to clear all the permissions for this site?
Are you sure that you want to clear this permission for this site?
Are you sure you want to delete this bookmark?
Are you sure you want to delete this password?
The editable text field for the website address.
The editable text field for the username.
The editable text field for the password.
A login with that username already exists
You don’t have any tabs open in Firefox on your other devices.
View a list of tabs from your other devices.
To add a new shortcut, remove one. Touch and hold the site and select remove.
Firefox can close tabs you haven’t viewed over the past month.
Set links from websites, emails, and messages to open automatically in Firefox.
We assign each product’s reviews a letter grade from A to F.
The adjusted rating is based only on reviews we believe to be reliable.
Highlights are from %s reviews within the last 80 days that we believe to be reliable.
open link to learn more about this collection
For your privacy, translations never leave your device. New languages and improvements coming soon! %1$s
There was a problem translating. Please try again.
Couldn’t load languages. Check your internet connection and try again.
Download language in data saving mode (%1$s)?
Always download languages in data saving mode
Select a language to manage ”always translate“ and ”never translate“ preferences.
Couldn’t load languages. Please check back later.
%1$s will offer to translate sites in this language.
%1$s will translate this language automatically when the page loads.
%1$s will never offer to translate sites in this language.
To add a new site: Visit it and select “Never translate this site” from the translation menu.
Couldn’t load sites. Please check back later.
Download complete languages for faster translations and to translate offline. %1$s
Couldn’t load languages. Please check back later.
If you delete this language, %1$s will download partial languages to your cache as you translate.
If you delete all languages, %1$s will download partial languages to your cache as you translate.
Download while in data saving mode (%1$s)?
We download partial languages to your cache to keep translations private.
Always download in data saving mode
%s is off-duty. We suggest turning protections back on.
You’re protected. If we spot something, we’ll let you know.
If something looks broken on this site, try turning off protections.
Protections are OFF. We suggest turning them back on.
Removing cookies and site data for %s might log you out of websites and clear shopping carts.
Please enter a number greater than zero
Exceeded the maximum number of tabs (%1$s) that can be generated in one operation

Add a fake login for this domain
Add new address for selected locale
Drag from top & use back gesture to exit
Drag from top & press back to exit
A root certificate will expire, causing some features to stop working on March 14.
A root certificate will expire, causing your version of Firefox to stop working properly.
Less than 7 days to left to update
On March 14, add-ons and other Firefox features will stop working because a root certificate is expiring.
Last chance to keep your Firefox
Your version of Firefox will stop working properly on March 14 because a root certificate is expiring.
Add-ons and some features will stop working on March 14.
You’re on an older version of Firefox
Update before March 14 to keep using add-ons and other features.
Some features will stop working tomorrow.
